√grabh 'seize'

present: [9.] gṛbhṇā́ti  gṛbhṇīté etc.  gṛhṇā́ti  gṛhṇīté etc.  gṛhāṇá V.+   -- [1.] gṛhṇati etc.  gṛhṇate   -- gṛhīthās  gṛhītá  gṛhīṣva  agṛhītām  

perfect: jagrā́bha etc.  jagṛbhma  jagṛbhyāt  jagṛbhriré  ajagrabham etc.  jagrā́ha etc. V.+  jagrhmá  jagrāhatus  

aorist: [1.] agrabham  agṛbhran  grabhat  gṛbhāṇá  gṛhyāt  agrāhi   -- gṛhe (3s.)  gṛhate (3p.)  gṛhāmahi   -- [3.] ajigrabhat  ajīgṛbham  ajigrahat   -- [4.] aghṛkṣata   -- [5.] agrabhīt  agrabhīṣus etc.  agrabhīṣata etc.  agrabhīm  agrahīt etc.  agrahīṣṭa etc. AV.+  agrahaiṣam  

future: [1.] grahīṣyati  grahīṣyate B.+  agrahīṣyat etc. B.+  agrahaiṣyat  gṛhīṣyati  grahiṣyati   -- [2.] grahītā  

verbal: gṛbhītá  gṛhītá AV.+  gráhītum B.+  gráhītavai  gráhītos  gṛbhītvā́  gṛhītvā́ AV.+  -gṛ́bhya  -gṛ́hya V.+  -grábhe  gṛbhé  -graham  gṛhaye  -grā́ham B.+  

secondary: passive: gṛhyáte etc. AV.+   -- intensive: jāgrah-  jarīgṛhya-   -- desiderative: jighṛkṣati  jighṛkṣate etc. B.+  jigrahīṣa-  ajagrabhaiṣan?   -- causative: gṛbháyant  grāhayati  grāhayate B.+  grāhyate etc.  

derivatives: grábha  gráha V.+  -grahin E.  gárbha V.+  grábhaṇa V.S.  gráhaṇa AV.+  grahaṇīya E.  -gráhi B.+  -grahiṣṇu S.  grahītavya B.+  grábhītṛ AV.B.  grahītṛ AV.+  grābhá V.B.S.  grāha AV.+  grāhaka E.+  grāhin E.+  grāhyà V.+  grā́hi V.  grā́huka B.  gṛ́bh V.B.  -gṛh C.  gṛbhá RV.  gṛhá V.+  gṛ́hya AV.+  gṛ́bhi V.  gṛhú RV.  -gṛhīti B.+  jighṛkṣā E.+  jighṛkṣu E.+  grāhayitavya C.  

Compare √glah. There seems to be no good reason why the root should not be given as gṛbh, gṛh.
